name: Rachel Roggenkemper
about:
I'm a dedicated graduate student at Cal Poly SLO, majoring in Statistics with a cross-disciplinary minor in Data Science. As part of the blended BS/MS program, I'm on track to earn my Master of Science in Statistics, set to graduate in June 2025.

My academic journey has been enriched by grading for esteemed professors within the Statistics department and contributing to a pivotal research projects on confidence intervals for the negative hypergeometric distribution adn statistics education through the FROST research program. Professionally, I've gained invaluable experience as a Catastrophe Co-op at Guy Carpenter. Beyond academia and the corporate world, I hold a California Real Estate License and have a keen interest in the real estate sector.

Data visualization is a particular passion of mine. I take pride in crafting compelling dashboards that present complex data in an accessible and engaging manner. Outside the realm of work and study, I'm an avid traveler with a love for skiing, pickleball, Formula 1, and soccer. Exploring new places and indulging in these sports keeps me balanced and inspired.

As I approach graduation, I am actively seeking full-time opportunities where I can apply my skills and continue to grow professionally.

Under the guidance of Dr. Bret Holladay, I am developing an algorithm to construct optimal confidence intervals for the parameters of the Negative Hypergeometric distribution. This project involves advanced statistical analysis and the creation of both a Shiny app and an R package to implement these methods. Alongside the technical development, I am writing a research paper with the goal of publication, contributing to the academic discourse on this complex statistical topic. This work aims to advance both theoretical understanding and practical application within the field.

As Co-President of the STAT Club at Cal Poly, my responsibilities encompassed a broad range of leadership and organizational tasks aimed at fostering a vibrant and inclusive community for all members. My primary duties included:
- STAT Buddy Program Leadership: Spearheaded the STAT Buddy Program, an initiative designed to pair underclassmen and transfer students with seasoned upperclassmen. This program aims to cultivate strong bonds within the department, offering newer students valuable advice, mentorship, and a sense of belonging. The program is structured to be flexible, accommodating students who join mid-year or after initial pairings. 
- Meeting and Event Support: Actively assisted all club officers in the planning, coordination, and execution of meetings and events, ensuring they ran smoothly and achieved their intended objectives.
- Social Media Management: Took charge of the club's social media platforms, crafting engaging content and campaigns to boost event attendance and keep members informed about upcoming activities.
- Fostering Inclusivity: Dedicatedly worked towards creating a warm and welcoming environment for all members, with a special emphasis on supporting incoming first-year students and ensuring their smooth transition into the club.

experiences.institution_name: SLO Hothouse (Cal Poly Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship)
experiences.description:
The Cal Poly Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship (CIE) helps students and community members acquire the tools, develop the skills and cultivate the mindset of an entrepreneur so that they may create economic and social value throughout the world. While it can mean starting a new business, entrepreneurial careers can be found or created in just about every field, industry, and organization. 

As the Entrepreneur in Residence (EIR), I have worked with over 100 businesses, primarily on their customer discovery process, ensuring they have found an "early adopter" persona for their business. The early adopter has these three characteristics. (1) They have a problem, (2) They know they have a problem and (3) They are actively searching for solutions to their problem. 

Most early stage companies do not understand how to use Design Thinking methodology to connect customer development and engineering design methodology based on facts and not opinions on what their targeted customer will happily pay for. I help them with this process.

Over the summer CIE has an incubator (https://cie.calpoly.edu/launch/accelerator/) where I have been actively involved. Key roles I have played include being the lead mentor for one of the teams over the summer to being on the weekly review board of experienced entrepreneurs providing each team feedback on their status since last week and on their most recent pitch. The weekly accountability to the review board is a best practice.

experiences.institution_name: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo
experiences.description:
Fall 2023 started my fourth year of co-teaching ENGR 463, ENGR 464, ENGR 465 - the "Interdisciplinary Entrepreneurship Senior Project" (3 quarter sequence)

Course Learning Outcomes: 
These are the learning outcomes for the entire three-quarter sequence.
1) Work effectively in an interdisciplinary team.
2) Utilize customer development and lean launch methodologies to develop
a. Value Proposition, Customer Archetypes, and Product Market Fit.
b. A complete and evolving business model for the design project.
3) Use Design Thinking methodology to connect customer development and engineering design methodology.
4) Design, construct, and test minimum viable products and prototypes. Testing includes both engineering validation tests as well as market feedback tests.
5) Develop and document scope and timeline for an engineering design project.
6) Apply a formal agile engineering design process to solve an open-ended design problem.
7) Develop Marketing Requirements and Product Requirements documents based on validated business models.
8) Formally define an engineering problem.
9) Apply creative techniques to develop conceptual solutions.
10) Apply structured decision schemes in a team environment.
11) Design subsystems within constraints of strength, size, materials, performance, cost, etc.
12) Gain experience applying principles of math, science, and engineering on design problems.
13) Apply current industrial design practice and techniques to engineering design problems.
14) Communicate and present engineering design project results orally, graphically and in writing
15) Practice engineering professionalism and understand societal responsibility.
16) Understand ethical decision making and challenges in both product and corporate development.
Fall 2023 started my fourth year of co-teaching ENGR 463, ENGR 464, ENGR 465 - the "Interdisciplinary Entrepreneurship Senior Project" (3 quarter sequence) Course Learning Outcomes: These are the learning outcomes for the entire three-quarter sequence. 1) Work effectively in an interdisciplinary team. 2) Utilize customer development and lean launch methodologies to develop a. Value Proposition, Customer Archetypes, and Product Market Fit. b. A complete and evolving business model for the design project. 3) Use Design Thinking methodology to connect customer development and engineering design methodology. 4) Design, construct, and test minimum viable products and prototypes. Testing includes both engineering validation tests as well as market feedback tests. 5) Develop and document scope and timeline for an engineering design project. 6) Apply a formal agile engineering design process to solve an open-ended design problem. 7) Develop Marketing Requirements and Product Requirements documents based on validated business models. 8) Formally define an engineering problem. 9) Apply creative techniques to develop conceptual solutions. 10) Apply structured decision schemes in a team environment. 11) Design subsystems within constraints of strength, size, materials, performance, cost, etc. 12) Gain experience applying principles of math, science, and engineering on design problems. 13) Apply current industrial design practice and techniques to engineering design problems. 14) Communicate and present engineering design project results orally, graphically and in writing 15) Practice engineering professionalism and understand societal responsibility. 16) Understand ethical decision making and challenges in both product and corporate development.

Fullstack Academy partners with the world’s leading universities to bring best-in-class, turnkey programs to their community of students and companies. We are on a mission to transform individuals, communities, and economies by teaching technologies that power the future.

We have tech bootcamps in 5 areas: Coding, Cybersecurity, DevOps, Data Analytics and Product Management with thousands of grads every year coming through our 18 university partners and our Academy which includes the Grace Hopper Coding Bootcamp for Women+ (https://www.gracehopper.com/). Growing the depth and breadth of relationships with employers for our grads across the country is the core focus of my Employer Partnerships role.

Caltech, San Jose State, Cal Poly SLO, the University of San Diego and Cal State East Bay (Oakland Center), and Colorado State are key university partnerships I formalized for Fullstack Academy in my initial Business Development role.

DMscore, is a marketplace for buyers and sellers of digital marketing services, anchored around a numeric DMscore. Our patent-pending, artificial intelligence technology measures and ranks hundreds of online marketing factors to provide a single, intuitive score that measures the success of marketing efforts by industry sector, at a hyper-local level. Ongoing tracking, tools, and our marketplace of best-in-class service providers empowers professionals across industries to grow their business, by attracting more, better clients online.

Dan is the Founder and was Chief Operating Officer of BrightScope, focusing on the day-to-day operations of the company. 

BrightScope®, Inc. is a financial information company that brings transparency to opaque markets. Through web-based software, BrightScope data drives better decision-making for individual investors, corporate plan sponsors, asset managers, broker-dealers, and financial advisors. BrightScope primarily operates in two primary segments: Retirement Plans and Wealth Management. 

Strategic Insight acquired BrightScope on November 1, 2016.

R&D SECTION MANAGER, WEB PRINTING SOLUTIONS, WEB SERVICES & SOFTWARE BUSINESS (2007–2008)
Directed the product centric activities of the "ePrint team" during the development of printing capabilities from mobile devices, and is now the organization’s ePrint initiative.

• Accelerated HP’s competitive advantage after proposing an innovative concept, won approval, and achieved funding for an application that enabled predictable printing from web browsers, and marketed as HP Smart Web printing software. The application was preinstalled on millions of laptops.
• Awarded four engineering patents throughout tenure with Hewlett-Packard. One additional patent was awarded during a summer position before graduation from Cal Poly.

TECHNOLOGY INTEGRATION MANAGER, TABBLO ACQUISITION (2007) 
Selected to serve as Post-Acquisition Technology Integration Manager after leading the technology analysis for the development of a successful proposal supporting the acquisition of www.Tabblo.com. 

• Led the hands-on integration activities of Tabblo’s technologies as well as their employees into HP.

R&D MASTER PROGRAM MANAGER (2005 – 2007) 
Secured funding after conceptualizing and presenting an idea for a simple, user-friendly photo printing software application, led the product team.
 
• Formerly HP Image Zone Express and renamed HP PhotoSmart Essential, the software was implemented by one HP developer and a 3rd party on a very small budget, and was so successful every printer division adopted a variant of the idea to replace the existing very large and slow .NET solution. 

Additional experience at Hewlett-Packard:
R&D Section Manager, Media (San Diego, CA)
Product Test & Regulations Manager, All-In-One Printers (San Diego, CA)
Software Quality Manager HP DeskJet (Vancouver, WA)
Firmware/Software Project Manager (Vancouver, WA)
Firmware Project Manager, Roseville Personal Computer Division (Roseville, CA)
Firmware Engineer, Roseville Terminals Division (Roseville, CA)

name: Amanda Zhong
about:
👋 Hello! I am a junior pursuing a B.A. in Business Administration, concentrating in Financial Management. I am looking into a future regarding financial consulting and transaction advisory services!

From my previous and current roles, I have gained valuable experiences that I am eager to apply to future endeavors. If you or any of your connections are aware of upcoming opportunities that align with my background and aspirations, I would greatly appreciate being considered. Thank you!

If you would like to connect with me more, feel free to reach me at amandazhong04@gmail.com or azhong04@calpoly.edu!
